comment.body:
Given that it hasn't had any activity for days I'd say no. Zero has potential, but I think people aren't willing to give up the convenience of clearnet to protect themselves. Personally, I don't use clearnet for anything except bitchute, various chans, and youtube but even then it's over VPN and TOR. Zero adds another layer that most people don't understand, and don't care to understand. 

I think that networks like this are purpose driven, and the purpose just isn't clear. Until then it'll be technology in search of a purpose.
